intro: Tropidocarpum gracile, commonly known as the slender starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other genera such as Impatiens and Hypericum. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in a whorled pattern around the stems. Tropidocarpum gracile is adapted to high-altitude environments, exhibiting a compact growth form to withstand cold and strong winds.
